text:
If a user is not in the admin, editor, or reviewer groups, they can't access
files in the pubname/modules URI path. The problem comes up when a user is given
edit permissions on a subtree. Since the editors load files from that path, they
now have a problem. A change to
/pubs/default/config/access-control/policies/modules/subtree-policy.acml should
fix the issue.
creator: rfrovarp@apache.org

text: i see no reason while those resources should be subject to access control anyway...

text: That's what I was kind of thinking, but wanted another opinion.
Are there any security implications if we open the modules URL space to the public?
creator: andreas@apache.org
rfrovarp@apache.org
text:
I'm not aware of any security implications. What is the policy for /modules? As
far as I know, modules that aren't publication specific are open to the public.
If no one has any objections I'll make the change to open it up tomorrow.
